fields.summary: Issue creation via email failed if email subject exceeds 255 characters

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Whenever you setup a Mail Handler in Service Desk using a non-ABP license, users are automatically created by the Mail Handler. This cannot be disabled in the UI while using this license.

# Setup JIRA. You can configure this JIRA instance to be Public or Private - it doesn't matter.
# Install JIRA Service Desk using a pre-ABP license. You will continue to use this license.
# Create a Service Desk Mail Handler in the email channel for Service Desk.
# E-Mail the account that this Mail Handler uses. 

*Expected result:*
If the email address is not recognized by the JIRA Server, new user and new request should not be created.

*Actual result:*
If the email address is not recognized by the JIRA Server, the user will be created on the JIRA Server. This user will be assigned to the JIRA User's group, as well as any other groups with JIRA User's Global Permission. This user will occupy a JIRA license.
Even if the JIRA Server is set to "Private", users will be created. This is only while using a pre-ABP license, so the SD isn't Public (there isn't an option to make it Public in pre-ABP licensed SD's).

*Workaround at this point:*

The only way to turn this off is to install an ABP license, and at that point you get the option to turn off Public Sign up. If Public Sign up is turned off, you finally get the error in the email processing log in Service Desk "Signup is not currently available". New users are finally no longer created. However, if you revert back to the old pre-ABP license, users will start being created again.
fields.summary: Users automatically being created when using non-ABP license

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1683].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Create a service desk
# Set e-mail with default configuration
# Create an issue to a customer through JIRA interface
# Check that the "Channel" under "Service Desk request" will be set to JIRA. 
# JIRA Service desk will not send notifications to such user
fields.summary: Create issue through JIRA interface doesn't send notification

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When a new issue is created the customer receives an email where the plain-text version contains this phrase:
"Your request has been created. If you'd like to add a comment to this request, just reply to this email."
This seems to be a standard text, even when no email setup for ServiceDesk has been made. The option to reply to the mail should only be mentioned when a reply would actually work.

Note that this is an issue only for the plain-text part of the mail, the html part doesn't has this issue.
fields.summary: Create issue mail suggest customers can reply to the mail even when mail isn't setup.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1679].
  {panel}

Hi,

Because our customer refers to ticket numbers in their own issue management system we add the JIRA issue number to the Summary title of an issue to display the number in the Servicedesk portal. Because it isn't displayed by default in the Servicedesk portal.

Could it be made detault, so the JIRA issue number does not need to be included in the Summary field anymore?
This very simple improvement would improve the user experience considerably.
fields.summary: Display JIRA issue number in My request results

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4.Summary: 

When the customer adds a valid license he receives the following error message:
{quote}This add-on can't find the licensing role in your JIRA instance.{quote}

I was unable to get the same error message on my test instance  (license was valid).

Using the same combination as the customer:
JIRA 6.3.15
Service Desk 2.3.3
UPM 2.18.2

Message from the log file:
{code}JIRA ServiceDesk v2.3.3 #DevVersion built 2015-03-09T08:11:58.407+01:00 - The licence has changed to invalid (No license problems detected.).  Removing most modules....{code}

h4. Workaround

Customer is able to use an evaluation license to get Service Desk working.
fields.summary: Service Desk add-on can't find the licensing role in your JIRA instance.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1676].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a service desk project.
# Go to the Project's Administration > Role.
# Include a user who is not an agent to the "Service Desk Team" role e.g. User A.
# Create a new issue for that project through JIRA not Service Desk.
# Assign the issue to User A on the creation.

*Expected Result:*
The issue is created and assigned to User A.

*Actual Result:*
The issue is not created as User A is not eligible to be assigned even though the issue is created through JIRA Channel.
fields.summary: Able to Assign User beside Agents for Issue that is created through JIRA Channel

You have to sent an update to customer every 60 minutes until the Resolution is set.

What i need is to reset the counter if an update to the customer was given.

Is this possiple?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1665].
  {panel}



Hi,

I enabled service desk on one of our internal project. This project is used to track our internal IT tasks and I wanted to add a service desks on It for users not in the IT team.
The problem is that yet the users from the IT team are not able to work with the normal JIRA part of the project (they cannot assign or be assigned to issue). I understand the Agent/collaborator limitation on incidents created via Service desk but I didn't understant why developers cannot work on internal stuff (incident not opened via service desk)
On the other side, I also not understand why a developper cannot be assigned to work on a service desk incident as second level support (keeping the agent dispatching incident internally and communiactiong with the customer) like any normal service desk tool does.

Can you tell me if there is a solution?
fields.summary: Cannot assign an issue to a non Agent user

fields.description:
Hi,

This bug was previously fixed, but seems to have resurfaced.
Tested on both Firefox and Chrome, screenshots attached.

h4.Summary: 

When adding a code block in the details, the contents is not wrapped.
This happens in the latest version of firefox, but not in chrome (have not tested IE).

Similar bug was raised for 1.2.4 and marked fixed for 1.2.6.

h4.Steps to Reproduce:

# Create a service desk request.
# Add a code block in the details: {noformat}{code}create table table1(id, val1, val2, val3) as select id, val1, val2, something from something_something where a=1 and b=‘longer text'{code}{noformat}
# View the request on the customer portal


h4.Expected Results:

The code should wrap (see code_chrome.png)



h4.Actual Results:

The code goes through the *You Can* section. (see code_firefox.png)
fields.summary: In Firefox, {code} and {noformat} do not wrap on Customer Portal.

Can you tell me if there is a solution?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1659].
  {panel}

Steps to Reproduce:
* Create a custom field with a project context (preferably a JSD project).
* Go to the Queues tab and make a new Queue.
* Try selecting the custom field under *Issues to Show*.

Expected Results:
Able to select the custom field because the JQL should be only specific to the JSD project even if the project is not specified.

Actual Results:
Not able to select the custom field.

Workaround:
* Remove the project context from the custom field.
* Or add project query into the JQL field and specify the project so that the field is now specific to the JSD project.

!Untitled.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Can't choose custom fields bound by project context at JIRA Service Desk Queue JQL field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1657].
  {panel}

Service Desk requires certain properties on workflow transitions in order to function properly. It would be helpful to have a GUI-based utility to map a custom workflow for use with Service Desk.

The utility would grab all available statuses in a custom workflow and provide drop-down boxes to designate whether each status is:
* Waiting for customer
* Waiting for support
* Resolved

Based on the inputs, the necessary properties would automatically be applied to the workflow. It should include the option to automatically backup the workflow and prompt to check if the workflow should be published after modification.
fields.summary: Utility to Remap JIRA Workflows for use with Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1656].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Currently in Service Desk it's possible to link an entire Confluence Space to use as knowledge base article. No option to link a single page.

h4. Other things to consider
The Anonymous access permissions are usually tied to the space itself, and then you can restrict anonymous access from individual pages. So you would need to be able to somehow ONLY enable anonymous access for a single page without affecting the rest of the space.

h4. Desired resolution.
* the option to link a single page
* the option to allow anonymous access to a single page in Confluence.
fields.summary: Ability to link single Confluence page as Knowledge Base rather than entire space

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Replicated this problem on JIRA 6.3.15 and JIRA Service Desk 2.3.3.

h4. Steps to Replicate
# Create two users with e-mail addresses as follows:
#- customer1@test.local (customer1)
#- Customer2@test.local (customer2)
# Access your Service Desk enabled Project via *Project > <JSD Project>*.
# Inside the project, go to *Administration > Roles*.
# Add the {{customer1}} and {{customer2}} users to the {{Service Desk Customers}} role.
# Login as {{customer1}} to the customer portal with participants enabled.
# Create a new Request and try to add the e-mail address from {{customer2}} as a participant.

h4. Expected Result
The user is successfully added as a participant in the Request.

h4. Actual Result
The user is found by the application, but clicking on the *Add* button does not add the user nor close the pop-up:
!add_people.png!

h4. Workaround
There are two possible workarounds:
# Change the e-mail address from the user to lower case characters only.
# Turn On the option _'Customers can search for other customers when adding participants'_ (*<Your Service Desk> > Settings > Request Participants*).
fields.summary: Unable to Add Requests Participants when Search is Disabled and E-mail Contains Uppercase Letters

fields.description:
JSD is currently overriding the Tempo View all worklogs custom permission for users that aren't agents. This means that non agents are unable to view this panel in JSD.

This bug report is about preventing Service Desk from overriding Tempo permissions (and possible add-on permissions), so that it is no longer required to give JIRA users application access to Service Desk (and give them a Service Desk license).
fields.summary: Service Desk overrides Tempo (and other addons) custom permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1640].
  {panel}

We have a plugin that injects some javascript into SD customer portal. This plugin embellishes some custom fields with HTML generated based on REST calls to the plugin's REST endpoints. 

Our customer reported that their 'customer' users do not the proper embellishments, instead they get some Javascript error. It turned out that when a user who is not in jira-users (an SD 'customer') is accessing the page with our plugin on it, the plugin makes a REST call that gets 302-redirected to /servicedesk/customer/portal/1. Which means that everything gets broken. Adding @AnonymousAllowed annotation to the plugin's endpoint does not help, as it only works when the user is actually not logged-in. When they log in, apparently SD servlet filter (or whatever) redirects blindly to a bad place. 

This is breaking our plugin in very bad ways and we are likely losing sales because of this. 

Are there any workarounds for this behaviour? I have tried injecting a serlet filter, but it is not being invoked.

The plugin in question is https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.spartez.jira.plugins.ephor-for-jira, but the behaviour can be trivially reproduced with any plugin that has a REST endpoint. Just log in as an SD 'customer' and go to plugin's REST endpoint
fields.summary: SD redirects calls to any plugin's REST endpoints to /servicedesk/customer/portal/1

  {panel}

h3. Problem Desription
To allow Service Desk Admin to customize the text / custom fields / links in the Public Sign-up Page/Email Form.
Different companies have different preference over what information is needed from the customer
A certain subset of users will inadvertently glance over the details and when/if that happens, there is no way to proactively prevent them from clicking the wrong link (restart sign up vs continue sign up).

*Sample Email*
{code}
Click the button below to confirm your email address and create your new account!

This email will expire 24 hours after it was sent. You can restart the sign up process here.

Continue sign up
{code}
Ideally, the *continue sign up* link would be first and foremost and the *restart the sign up* link would be smaller at the end of the message.
fields.summary: As an SD Admin, I want the ability to customize the Public Sign-up Form / Page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1636].
  {panel}

I'm evaluating JIRA Service Desk plugin (version 2.3.3, should be newest) and faced one "bug". It's not fatal or not even severe but might cause frustation. Seems that it's possible to reply to customer (by transferring to Waiting for customer) by adding only internal comment. Customer will receive notification and from his point of view _nothing_ is commented but request is on his responsibility "Requester action Needed". He might wonder why as there is not comment visible.

I would like to add a new validator (to JIRA Service Desk workflow) that when transferring issue to customer comment is mandatory and it should *not* be internal comment. I couldn't add validator (this is default vanilla JIRA installation, maybe comment presence needs some plugin?). Even there is validator for checking mandatory comment I'm not sure could it be defined that it should be public comment, not internal?

Use case:

FAIL:
- Press "Respond to customer"
- Add internal comment
-> no new information is sent to customer but responsibility is transferred to him

SHOULD BE:
- Press "Respond to customer"
- Require public comment (don't allow internal comment), validator is needed
-> comment is sent to customer

Thanks.
fields.summary: Shouldn't be able to reply to customer with internal comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1635].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a Test Service Desk project and configure Outgoing Mail.
# Logging as Customer that have a working email address into the Test Customer Portal.
# Create a Request.
# Log out and logging in as the Agent of the Test Service Desk project.
# Attach a file and "Respond to Customer" while using the Attachment Text Formatting in the comment:
{code}[^JIRA61_db_schema.pdf]{code}
# Log out.
# Wait until the notification is sent out and check the Customer Mailbox.
# Click on the Attachment Hyperlink.

*Expected Results:*
Customer will be redirected to the Customer Portal before able to view the attachment.

*Actual Result:*
Customer will be redirected to JIRA which they do not have permission to access to.

*Notes:*
* This is the URL generated in the email from the attachment:
{code}http://10.60.4.135:6315/secure/attachment/10001/10001_JIRA61_db_schema.pdf{code}
* where when clicking the URL is changing to:
{code}http://10.60.4.135:6315/login.jsp?permissionViolation=true&os_destination=%2Fsecure%2Fattachment%2F10001%2F10001_JIRA61_db_schema.pdf&page_caps=&user_role={code}
fields.summary: Attachment Hyperlink in Email Notification redirecting to JIRA when customer is not logging in

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1634].
  {panel}

We are in process of evaluating JIRA Service Desk solution setup within our Company.  We tested JSD 1.2 – 2.3 features. We have major blocking Issue for our setup JIRA + JIRA Service Desk. 

First, let me explain our business case Issue. We are using one JIRA project for supporting many different customers.  Customer information is present as custom field data.  Our plan would be having for each customer their own Request Type forms.

Must have:
-          one Customer Portal with many Individual Customer Request Types (Forms),
-          each customer should not have permission to access Request Forms but only their own

This requires:
-          Additional Permission Scheme with Request Type Access level,
-          Or we can define per user access mapping restriction to each Request Type

We can’t implement many projects = Customer Portals as it is current setup.

Is it possible to add this suggestion as new feature?
fields.summary: One Customer Portal with Permission Scheme for Request Type Access (Forms) level

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create two dummy Service Desk project.
# Login as Customer and access one of the Customer Portal.
# Create a new Request.
# Log out and logging in as JIRA Admin with Agents permission.
# Move the issue that is just recently created to the second dummy SDS project without making any changes on any fields.

*Expected Result:*
* With the same Issue Type and Request Type, the issue moved without any details missing.

*Actual Result*:
* In Service Desk request section, the Request Type is "No Match"

*Notes:*
* The issue is moved without any issue and it is showing on the customer "My Request" page.
* Including Customer Request Type in the View Issue screen will shown the correct Request Type.
fields.summary: Request Type value is "No Match" when being moved.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1632].
  {panel}

If you navigate to a service desk via the link at the top of a jira instance

http://cl.ly/image/1m2Y1t320J3C
Service Desk menu -> All Service Desks

http://cl.ly/image/011m401V1900
Find a desk -> Customer Portal

This opens up a dialog. Now, attempt to file a ticket from this dialog. When I clicked on the submit button on the create ticket form, I got a spinner for around 20 seconds. Because of this latency I went to another tab or got a coffee or something, I don't remember what.

When I came back, my spinner was gone and the form was still present with indication of success or failure. I clicked create again. This time I had the same experience. No indication of success or failure.

h3. Summary
Confluence has the ability to search and pull up text within attachments. 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Searching+Confluence#SearchingConfluence-Searchthecontentofattachments

When linking Service Desk to Confluence, on the Customer Portal, find a solution should also pull up attachments that match the search term.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
Create an application Link between Confluence and JIRA
Go to Service Desk -> Settings -> Link To A Knowledge Base
Select a Space
Go to the Customer Portal -> Search for text within an attachment (reproduced with a PDF)

h3. Expected Results:
The search results bring up pages that also show that include the search term in the attachments

h3. Actual Results:
Pages don't show up that have attachments that include the search term

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1627].
{panel}
As a Project Administrator, I would like to have the ability to display a different URL for JIRA Service Desk (e.g. support.company.com) instead of jira.xxx.com
h3. Problem Definition

In JIRA Service Desk, customers must access JIRA by using a Service Desk URL, which can sometimes be quite a long path, depending on the portal.
h3. Suggested Solution
 - Create the ability to have a Short URL option on the portal, (like short url's in Confluence pages)
 - Create the ability to have customisable short URL's that could point to different portals in JIRA Service Desk.
 - Create the ability to have this configured per project and global

If implemented, the solution should cover scenarios with Data Center and SSO setups

h3. Workaround

Use a Reverse Proxy or URL redirect service external from JIRA.

Another workaround is described in [How to customize customer portal URL in JIRA Service Desk Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-customize-customer-portal-url-in-jira-service-desk-server-847755218.html]
 * _Please ensure you test this first on your test instance before you implement on your production._
 * _Please also note that Atlassian does not support this customization._
fields.summary: Create ability to customize the Customer Portal URL in JIRA ServiceDesk

h3. Summary
Currently JIRA Service Desk Mail Logging is internal to JIRA and it is difficult to capture this information into log files for further analysis. This can make it difficult for our users and Support to identify problems with the JIRA Service Desk Mail handler. 

h3. Expected Results
A log file that can be configured for verbosity should exist that shows details of the ServiceDesk and details of it handling mail both inbound, and out-bound.

h3. Actual Results
You need to use the web interface to review the mail log for JIRA Service Desk.

h3. Notes
* Steps to access the JIRA Service Desk Mail log can be accessed from: [Managing the email channel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Managing+the+email+channel] It would be great to improve that so we can enable more output to the logs when necessary. Similar to the Incoming Mail in JIRA's Handlers.
* It would be great as well if there is a way to filter the status that is shown on the log from the UI. Meaning we could just filter what is "Failed" or "Success".
fields.summary: Improve mail logging

A central portal often gets asked for request that are not in its domain.

Standing Desk Requests

The IT team is not responsible for providing standing desks.  This is handled by the Office Team on Level 2.  Click here [http://some.other/portallink] to ask for a standing desk.  Or contact Sherry on ext 2038......

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If an issue's reporter is an agent, then internal comments are displayed as public comments. This means that any customers who are participants can see all internal comments. Changing the reporter to a customer will cause all the internal comments to no longer be visible to customers. While the reporter is an agent, any customer participants will also receive notifications for the internal comments, which are presented only as public comments.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Service Desk Issue with a reporter who is an agent
# Attempt to set the comment internal
# Post the comment

h3. Expected Results

The comment is posted as internal.

h3. Actual Results

The comment appears like it is a public comment. Internally the restriction exists, so changing the reporter to a customer will again hide the comments.

h3. Workaround

Ensure the [Raising requests on behalf of customers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Raising+requests+on+behalf+of+customers] approach to creating issues is followed. If not, changing the reporter through JIRA to be the appropriate user will allow that agent to create internal comments on the issue, and it will also restrict any comments which were created as internal.
fields.summary: When a reporter is an agent, internal comments are not restricted

fields.description:
When a comment is created in Service Desk, two entries are created in the entity_property table. The first has an entity name of CommentProperty and the second has an entity name of sd.comment.property.

If you delete an issue or a comment from an issue, Service Desk removes the CommentProperty entity but does not remove the sd.comment.property entity, thus resulting in unnecessary and unneeded data being stored in the database.
fields.summary: Entities not completely cleaned up when issues deleted

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce:
# Login to one of the Customer Portal and raise two request.
# Then, login as an Agent and view on of the ticket from JIRA side.
# "Respond to Customer" and mentioned the other ticket in the comment by type in the Issue Key.
# Log out and login back again as the Customer.
# Click on the mentioned ticket.

h4. Expected Result:
The Customer would be redirected to the other ticket still in Customer Portal view.

h4. Actual Result:
The Customer will be redirected to JIRA rather than Customer Portal as the URL is still using JIRA Issue View.

h4. Notes:
* As there is features like "Adding Participants" there is a possibility that the agent would mentioned another ticket on the responds.
* There is also a possibility that the customer raise multiple request that could be related to each other.
* It would be confusing to the customer as when they clicked on the link there is a permission violation in which the customer should have the permission to view the ticket.
* It might be great if the way that the link is generated is different from "Respond to Customer" and "Internal Comments".

h4. Workaround:
Use a Wiki Markup instead:
*\[JIRA-123\|http://jira/servicedesk/customer/portal/2/JIRA-123\]*
fields.summary: Mentioned Issue Key Link not being generated as Customer Portal URL.

fields.description:
Profile picture/avatar of *People Involved* column in the Service Desk Customer Portal are not displayed in when logged in as a customer. I have tested this on version 2.3 , and the user who reported this was on version 2.2

If logged in as an agent, all avatars are visible. Refer to the image below :
!agent.png|thumbnail!

If a customer logs in, they  are only able to see their own avatar and the avatar generated by _Gravatar_. Uploaded avatars of other *People Involved* are not visible. Refer to the image below : 
!customer.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "People Involved" column avatars does not display for Customers

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1578].
  {panel}

This issue occurred when trying to find a way to open "find a solution" Confluence page in then own window (e.g. so you can interact with the Confluence page). There is not easy way (short of right clicking) that you can do this, this should be possible. 

But the bug can be seen in the attached screenshot.

Double clicking a result, essentially spawns two model windows the second contains extra characters.

You have to click cancel twice to get our of the modal view.
fields.summary: Double clicking results in the "find a solution" search injects characters into underlying page name.
